item.Name: Master Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Catches a wild Pokémon without fail.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Ultra Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 2×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Great Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1.5×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Poke Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Safari Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1.5×.

This item can only be used in the great marsh or kanto safari zone.

item.Name: Net Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon is water- or bug-type, this ball has a catch rate of 3×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Dive Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon was encountered by surfing or fishing, this ball has a catch rate of 3.5×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Nest Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  Has a catch rate of given by `(40 - level) / 10`, where `level` is the wild Pokémon's level, to a maximum of 3.9× for level 1 Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon's level is higher than 30, this ball has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Repeat Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon's species is marked as caught in the trainer's Pokédex, this ball has a catch rate of 3×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Timer Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  Has a catch rate of 1.1× on the first turn of the battle and increases by 0.1× every turn, to a maximum of 4× on turn 30.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Luxury Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.  Whenever the caught Pokémon's happiness increases, it increases by one extra point.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Premier Ball
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

item.Name: Potion
item.Effect:
Used on a friendly Pokémon
:   Restores 20 HP.

item.Name: Antidote
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures poison.

item.Name: Burn Heal
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures a burn.

item.Name: Ice Heal
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures freezing.

item.Name: Awakening
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures sleep.

item.Name: Paralyze Heal
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures paralysis.

item.Name: Full Restore
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores HP to full and cures any status ailment and confusion.

item.Name: Max Potion
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores HP to full.

item.Name: Hyper Potion
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 200 HP.

item.Name: Super Potion
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 50 HP.

item.Name: Full Heal
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures any status ailment and confusion.

item.Name: Revive
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Revives the Pokémon and restores half its HP.

item.Name: Max Revive
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Revives the Pokémon and restores its HP to full.

item.Name: Fresh Water
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 50 HP.

item.Name: Soda Pop
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 60 HP.

item.Name: Lemonade
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 80 HP.

item.Name: Moomoo Milk
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 100 HP.

item.Name: Energy Powder
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 50 HP.  Decreases happiness by 5/5/10.

item.Name: Energy Root
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 200 HP.  Decreases happiness by 10/10/15.

item.Name: Heal Powder
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures any status ailment.  Decreases happiness by 5/5/10.

item.Name: Revival Herb
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Revives a fainted Pokémon and restores its HP to full.  Decreases happiness by 10/10/15.

item.Name: Ether
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 10 PP for a selected move.

item.Name: Max Ether
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores PP to full for a selected move.

item.Name: Elixir
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 10 PP for each move.

item.Name: Max Elixir
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores PP to full for each move.

item.Name: Lava Cookie
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures any status ailment and confusion.

item.Name: Berry Juice
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 20 HP.

item.Name: Sacred Ash
item.Effect:
Used
:   Revives all fainted Pokémon in the party and restores their HP to full.

item.Name: Hp Up
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases HP effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.

item.Name: Protein
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases Attack effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.

item.Name: Iron
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases Defense effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.

item.Name: Carbos
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases Speed effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.

item.Name: Calcium
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases Special Attack effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.

item.Name: Rare Candy
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases level by 1.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.

item.Name: Pp Up
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases a selected move's max PP by 20% its original max PP, to a maximum of 1.6×.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.

item.Name: Zinc
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases Special Defense effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.

item.Name: Pp Max
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases a selected move's max PP to 1.6× its original max PP.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.

item.Name: Guard Spec
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Protects the target's stats from being lowered for the next five turns.  Increases happiness by 1/1/0.

item.Name: Dire Hit
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Increases the target's critical hit chance by one stage until it leaves the field.  Increases happiness by 1/1/0.

item.Name: X Attack
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Raises the target's Attack by one stage.  Increases happiness by 1/1/0.

item.Name: X Defense
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Raises the target's Defense by one stage.  Increases happiness by 1/1/0.

item.Name: X Speed
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Raises the target's Speed by one stage.  Increases happiness by 1/1/0.

item.Name: X Accuracy
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Raises the target's accuracy by one stage.  Increases happiness by 1/1/0.

item.Name: X Sp Atk
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Raises the target's Special Attack by one stage.  Increases happiness by 1/1/0.

item.Name: Poke Doll
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Ends a wild battle.  Cannot be used in trainer battles.

item.Name: Fluffy Tail
item.Effect:
Used in battle
:   Ends a wild battle.  Cannot be used in trainer battles.

item.Name: Blue Flute
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures sleep.

item.Name: Yellow Flute
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Cures confusion.

item.Name: Red Flute
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Cures attraction.

item.Name: Black Flute
item.Effect:
Used outside of battle
:   Decreases the wild Pokémon encounter rate by 50%.

item.Name: White Flute
item.Effect:
Used outside of battle
:   Doubles the wild Pokémon encounter rate.

item.Name: Shoal Salt
item.Effect: No effect.

item.Name: Shoal Shell
item.Effect: No effect.

item.Name: Red Shard
item.Effect:
No effect.

In Diamond and Pearl, trade ten for a sunny day TM in the house midway along the southern section of sinnoh route 212.

In Platinum, trade to move tutors on sinnoh route 212, in snowpoint city, and in the survival area.  Eight shards total are required per tutelage, but the particular combination of colors varies by move.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a cheri berry, a leppa berry, and a pecha berry with the Juggler near the Pokémon Center in violet city.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a persim berry, a pomeg berry, and a razz berry with the Juggler near the pal park entrance in fuchsia city.

item.Name: Blue Shard
item.Effect:
No effect.

In Diamond and Pearl, trade ten for a rain dance TM in the house midway along the southern section of sinnoh route 212.

In Platinum, trade to move tutors on sinnoh route 212, in snowpoint city, and in the survival area.  Eight shards total are required per tutelage, but the particular combination of colors varies by move.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a chesto berry, an oran berry, and a wiki berry with the Juggler near the Pokémon Center in violet city.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a bluk berry, a cornn berry, and a kelpsy berry with the Juggler near the pal park entrance in fuchsia city.

item.Name: Yellow Shard
item.Effect:
No effect.

In Diamond and Pearl, trade ten for a sandstorm TM in the house midway along the southern section of sinnoh route 212.

In Platinum, trade to move tutors on sinnoh route 212, in snowpoint city, and in the survival area.  Eight shards total are required per tutelage, but the particular combination of colors varies by move.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for an aspear berry, a iapapa berry, and a sitrus berry with the Juggler near the Pokémon Center in violet city.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a grepa berry, a nomel berry, and a pinap berry with the Juggler near the pal park entrance in fuchsia city.

item.Name: Green Shard
item.Effect:
No effect.

In Diamond and Pearl, trade ten for a hail TM in the house midway along the southern section of sinnoh route 212.

In Platinum, trade to move tutors on sinnoh route 212, in snowpoint city, and in the survival area.  Eight shards total are required per tutelage, but the particular combination of colors varies by move.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for an aguav berry, a lum berry, and a rawst berry with the Juggler near the Pokémon Center in violet city.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a durin berry, a hondew berry, and a wepear berry with the Juggler near the pal park entrance in fuchsia city.

item.Name: Super Repel
item.Effect:
Used outside of battle
:   Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon.  This effect wears off after the trainer takes 200 steps.

item.Name: Max Repel
item.Effect:
Used outside of battle
:   Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon.  This effect wears off after the trainer takes 250 steps.

item.Name: Escape Rope
item.Effect:
Used outside of battle
:   Transports the trainer to the last-entered dungeon entrance.  Cannot be used outside, in buildings, or in distortion world, sinnoh hall of origin 1, spear pillar, or turnback cave.

item.Name: Repel
item.Effect:
Used outside of battle
:   Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon.  This effect wears off after the trainer takes 100 steps.

item.Name: Sun Stone
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves a cottonee into whimsicott, a gloom into bellossom, a petilil into lilligant, or a sunkern into sunflora.

item.Name: Moon Stone
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves a clefairy into clefable, a jigglypuff into wigglytuff, a munna into musharna, a nidorina into nidoqueen, a nidorino into nidoking, or a skitty into delcatty.

item.Name: Fire Stone
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an eevee into flareon, a growlithe into arcanine, a pansear into simisear, or a vulpix into ninetales.

item.Name: Thunder Stone
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an eelektrik into eelektross, an eevee into jolteon, or a pikachu into raichu.

item.Name: Water Stone
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an eevee into vaporeon, a lombre into ludicolo, a panpour into simipour, a poliwhirl into poliwrath, a shellder into cloyster, or a staryu into starmie.

item.Name: Leaf Stone
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an exeggcute into exeggutor, a gloom into vileplume, a nuzleaf into shiftry, a pansage into simisage, or a weepinbell into victreebel.

item.Name: Tiny Mushroom
item.Effect: Vendor trash.

item.Name: Big Mushroom
item.Effect: Vendor trash.

item.Name: Pearl
item.Effect: Vendor trash.

item.Name: Big Pearl
item.Effect: Vendor trash.

item.Name: Stardust
item.Effect: Vendor trash.

item.Name: Star Piece
item.Effect: Vendor trash.

item.Name: Nugget
item.Effect: Vendor trash.

item.Name: Heart Scale
item.Effect: Trade one to the Move Relearner near the shore in pastoria city or with the Move Deleter in blackthorn city to teach one party Pokémon a prior level-up move.

item.Name: Root Fossil
item.Effect: Give to a scientist in the mining museum in oreburgh city or the Museum of Science in pewter city to receive a lileep.

item.Name: Claw Fossil
item.Effect: Give to a scientist in the mining museum in oreburgh city or the Museum of Science in pewter city to receive a anorith.

item.Name: Helix Fossil
item.Effect: Give to a scientist in the mining museum in oreburgh city or the Museum of Science in pewter city to receive a omanyte.

item.Name: Dome Fossil
item.Effect: Give to a scientist in the mining museum in oreburgh city or the Museum of Science in pewter city to receive a kabuto.

item.Name: Old Amber
item.Effect: Give to a scientist in the mining museum in oreburgh city or the Museum of Science in pewter city to receive a aerodactyl.

item.Name: Cheri Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is paralyzed, it consumes this item to cure the paralysis.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures paralysis.

item.Name: Chesto Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is asleep, it consumes this item to wake up.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures sleep.

item.Name: Pecha Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is poisoned, it consumes this item to cure the poison.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures poison.

item.Name: Rawst Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is burned, it consumes this item to cure the burn.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures a burn.

item.Name: Aspear Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is frozen, it consumes this item to thaw itself.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures freezing.

item.Name: Leppa Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is out of PP for one of its moves, it consumes this item to restore 10 of that move's PP.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 10 PP for a selected move.

item.Name: Oran Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 10 HP.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 10 HP.

item.Name: Persim Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is confused, it consumes this item to cure the confusion.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures confusion.

item.Name: Lum Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is afflicted with a major status ailment, it consumes this item to cure the ailment.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures any major status ailment.

item.Name: Sitrus Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/4 its max HP.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 1/4 the Pokémon's max HP.

item.Name: Figy Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/8 its max HP.  If the holder dislikes spicy flavors (i.e., has a nature that lowers Attack), it will also become confused.

item.Name: Wiki Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/8 its max HP.  If the holder dislikes dry flavors (i.e., has a nature that lowers Special Attack), it will also become confused.

item.Name: Mago Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/8 its max HP.  If the holder dislikes sweet flavors (i.e., has a nature that lowers Speed), it will also become confused.

item.Name: Aguav Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/8 its max HP.  If the holder dislikes bitter flavors (i.e., has a nature that lowers Special Defense), it will also become confused.

item.Name: Iapapa Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/8 its max HP.  If the holder dislikes sour flavors (i.e., has a nature that lowers Defense), it will also become confused.

item.Name: Razz Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Bluk Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Nanab Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Wepear Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Pinap Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers HP effort by 10.

item.Name: Kelpsy Berry
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Attack effort by 10.

item.Name: Qualot Berry
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Defense effort by 10.

item.Name: Hondew Berry
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Special Attack effort by 10.

item.Name: Grepa Berry
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Special Defense effort by 10.

item.Name: Tamato Berry
item.Effect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Speed effort by 10.

item.Name: Cornn Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Magost Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Rabuta Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Nomel Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Spelon Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Pamtre Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Watmel Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Durin Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Belue Berry
item.Effect: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

item.Name: Liechi Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its Attack by one stage.

item.Name: Ganlon Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its Defense by one stage.

item.Name: Salac Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its Speed by one stage.

item.Name: Petaya Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its Special Attack by one stage.

item.Name: Apicot Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its Special Defense by one stage.

item.Name: Lansat Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its critical hit chance by one stage.

item.Name: Starf Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise a random stat by two stages.

item.Name: Enigma Berry
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder takes super-effective damage, it consumes this item to restore 1/4 its max HP.

item.Name: Bright Powder
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   Moves targeting the holder have 0.9× chance to hit.

item.Name: White Herb
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   At the end of each turn, if any of the holder's stats have a negative stat modifier, the holder consumes this item to remove the modifiers from those stats.

item.Name: Macho Brace
item.Effect:
Held
:   When the holder would gain effort due to battle, it gains double that effort instead.

Held in battle
:   Holder has half its Speed.

item.Name: Exp Share
item.Effect:
Held
:   Experience is split across two groups: Pokémon who participated in battle, and Pokémon holding this item.  Each Pokémon earns experience as though it had battled alone, divided by the number of Pokémon in its group, then divided by the number of groups. Pokémon holding this item who also participated in battle effectively earn experience twice.

    Fainted Pokémon never earn experience, and empty groups are
ignored; thus, if a single Pokémon is holding this item and the only Pokémon who battled faints from explosion, the holder will gain full experience.

item.Name: Quick Claw
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   Whenever the holder attempts to use a move, it has a 3/16 chance to act first among moves with the same priority.  If multiple Pokémon have this effect at the same time, Speed is the tie-breaker as normal, but the effect of trick room is ignored.

item.Name: Soothe Bell
item.Effect:
Held
:   When the holder would earn happiness for any reason, it earns twice that amount instead.

item.Name: Mental Herb
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is attracted, it consumes this item to cure the attraction.

item.Name: Choice Band
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   Holder has 1.5× its Attack.  When the holder attempts to use a move, all its other moves are disabled until it leaves battle or loses this item.

    The restriction ends even if this item is swapped for another Choice item
via trick or switcheroo.

item.Name: Kings Rock
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   Holder's damaging moves have a 10% chance to make their target flinch.  This chance applies independently to each hit of a multi-hit move.

    This item's chance is rolled independently of any other move effects;
e.g., a move with a 30% chance to flinch normally will have a 37% total chance to flinch when used with this item, because 3% of the time, both effects activate.

Held by poliwhirl or slowbro
:   Holder evolves into politoed or slowking, respectively, when traded.

item.Name: Silver Powder
item.Effect:
Held in battle
:   Holder's bug-type moves have 1.2× their power.

item.Name: Amulet Coin
item.Effect:
Held
:   If the holder participated in a trainer battle, the trainer earns twice the usual prize money.  This effect applies even if the holder fainted.

    This effect does not stack with any other similar effect.

item.Name: Cleanse Tag
item.Effect: Held by lead Pokémon: Prevents wild battles with Pokémon that are lower level than the holder.

item.Name: Soul Dew
item.Effect: Held by Latias or Latios: Increases the holder's Special Attack and Special Defense by 50%.

item.Name: Deep Sea Tooth
item.Effect: Held by Clamperl: Doubles the holder's Special Attack.  Evolves the holder into Huntail when traded.

item.Name: Deep Sea Scale
item.Effect: Held by Clamperl: Doubles the holder's Special Defense.  Evolves the holder into Gorebyss when traded.

item.Name: Smoke Ball
item.Effect: Held: In wild battles, attempts to run away on the holder's turn will always succeed.

item.Name: Everstone
item.Effect: Held: Prevents the holder from evolving naturally.  Evolution initiated by the trainer (Stones, etc) will still work.

item.Name: Focus Band
item.Effect: Held: If the holder is attacked for regular damage that would faint it, this item has a 10% chance to prevent the holder's HP from lowering below 1.

item.Name: Lucky Egg
item.Effect: Held: Increases any Exp the holder gains by 50%.

item.Name: Scope Lens
item.Effect: Held: Raises the holder's critical hit counter by 1.

item.Name: Metal Coat
item.Effect:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Steel moves by 20%.
Held by Onix or Scyther: Evolves the holder into Steelix or Scizor when traded, respectively.

item.Name: Leftovers
item.Effect: Held: Heals the holder by 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.

item.Name: Dragon Scale
item.Effect: Held by Seadra: Evolves the holder into Kingdra when traded.

item.Name: Light Ball
item.Effect: Held by Pikachu: Doubles the holder's initial Attack and Special Attack.

item.Name: Soft Sand
item.Effect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Ground moves by 20%.

item.Name: Hard Stone

item.Name: Up Grade
item.Effect: Held by Porygon: Evolves the holder into Porygon2 when traded.

item.Name: Shell Bell
item.Effect: Held: Heals the holder by 1/8 of any damage it inflicts.

item.Name: Sea Incense
item.Effect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Water moves by 20%.

item.Name: Lax Incense
item.Effect: Held: Increases the holder's Evasion by 5%.

item.Name: Lucky Punch
item.Effect: Held by Chansey: Raises the holder's critical hit counter by 2.

item.Name: Metal Powder
item.Effect: Held by Ditto: Increases the holder's initial Defense and Special Defense by 50%.

item.Name: Thick Club
item.Effect: Held by Cubone or Marowak: Doubles the holder's Attack.

item.Name: Stick
item.Effect: Held by Farfetch'd: Raises the holder's critical hit counter by 2.

item.Name: Red Scarf
item.Effect: Held: Increases the holder's Coolness during a Super Contest's Visual Competition.

item.Name: Yellow Scarf
item.Effect: Held: Increases the holder's Toughness during a Super Contest's Visual Competition.

item.Name: Town Map
item.Effect: Displays a map of the region including the trainer's position, location names, visited towns, gym locations, and where the trainer has been walking recently.

item.Name: Vs Seeker
item.Effect: Reveals trainers who want a rematch, by showing !! over their heads.  Each use drains the battery; requires 100 steps to charge.

item.Name: Coin Case
item.Effect: Contains the Coins used by the Game Corner, to a maximum of 50,000.

item.Name: Old Rod
item.Effect: Used to find Pokémon on the Old Rod list for an area, which are generally Magikarp or similar.

item.Name: Good Rod
item.Effect: Used to find Pokémon on the Good Rod list for an area, which are generally mediocre.

item.Name: Super Rod
item.Effect: Used to find Pokémon on the Super Rod list for an area, which are generally the best available there.

item.Name: Bicycle
item.Effect: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  In high gear, allows the trainer to hop over some rocks and ascend muddy slopes.

item.Name: Ss Ticket
item.Effect:
Allows passage on a ferry.

The same item is used for different ferries between different games.

item.Name: Contest Pass
item.Effect: Allows the trainer to enter Contests.

item.Name: Storage Key
item.Effect: Grants access to the Team Galactic warehouse in Veilstone City.

item.Name: Secret Key
item.Effect:
Used by trainer in the Galactic Eterna Building, on the ground floor, to the left of the TV
:   Unlocks the secret rotom room, in which there are five appliances which can change Rotom's form.

item.Name: Dowsing Machine
item.Effect:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Searches for hidden items.

item.Name: Red Orb
item.Effect: Causes groudon to appear in the embedded tower.

item.Name: Blue Orb
item.Effect: Causes kyogre to appear in the embedded tower.

item.Name: Card Key
item.Effect:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Opens doors in the goldenrod city Radio Tower.

item.Name: Basement Key
item.Effect:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Opens the door to the basement tunnel under goldenrod city.

item.Name: Orange Mail
item.Effect:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.

item.Name: Mach Bike
item.Effect: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  Faster than the acro bike.  Allows the trainer to ascend muddy slopes.

item.Name: Acro Bike
item.Effect: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  Slower than the mach bike.  Can perform various tricks, allowing the trainer to reach certain special areas.

item.Name: Wailmer Pail
item.Effect: Waters Berry plants.

item.Name: Devon Goods
item.Effect: Contains a machine part to be delivered to Captain Stern.

item.Name: Soot Sack
item.Effect: Collects soot when walking through tall grass on hoenn route 113.

item.Name: Pokeblock Case
item.Effect: Stores Pokéblocks.

item.Name: Letter
item.Effect: Contains a letter to be delivered to Steven.

item.Name: Eon Ticket
item.Effect: Provides access to southern island and either latias or latios, whichever is not available roaming around Hoenn.

item.Name: Scanner
item.Effect: May be traded to Captain Stern for a deep sea tooth or a deep sea scale.

item.Name: Go Goggles
item.Effect: Allows the trainer to enter the desert on hoenn route 111.

item.Name: Meteorite
item.Effect:
RSE: May be traded to Professor Cozmo for tm27.

FRLG: A meteorite to be delivered to Lostelle's father.

item.Name: Rm 1 Key
item.Effect: Unlocks room 1 on the abandoned ship.

item.Name: Rm 2 Key
item.Effect: Unlocks room 2 on the abandoned ship.

item.Name: Rm 4 Key
item.Effect: Unlocks room 4 on the abandoned ship.

item.Name: Rm 6 Key
item.Effect: Unlocks room 6 on the abandoned ship.

item.Name: Devon Scope
item.Effect: Reveals invisble kecleon on the overworld.

item.Name: Oaks Parcel
item.Effect: A parcel to be delivered to Professor Oak for a Pokédex.

item.Name: Poke Flute
item.Effect: Wakes up sleeping Pokémon.  Required to wake up sleeping snorlax on the overworld.

item.Name: Bike Voucher
item.Effect: May be traded for a bicycle.

item.Name: Gold Teeth
item.Effect: The Safari Zone warden's teeth, to be returned to him for hm04.

item.Name: Lift Key
item.Effect: Operates the elevator in the Celadon Rocket Hideout.

item.Name: Silph Scope
item.Effect: Identifies ghosts in pokemon tower.

item.Name: Fame Checker
item.Effect: Records information on various famous people.

item.Name: Tm Case
item.Effect: Stores TMs and HMs.

item.Name: Berry Pouch
item.Effect: Stores Berries.

item.Name: Teachy Tv
item.Effect: Teaches beginning trainers basic information.

item.Name: Tri Pass
item.Effect: Provides access to the first three Sevii Islands.

item.Name: Rainbow Pass
item.Effect: Provides access to the Sevii Islands.

item.Name: Tea
item.Effect: Used to bribe the saffron city guards for entry to the city.

item.Name: Mysticticket
item.Effect: Provides access to Navel Rock, ho oh, and lugia.

item.Name: Auroraticket
item.Effect: Provides access to Birth Island and deoxys.

item.Name: Powder Jar
item.Effect: Holds Berry Powder from Berry Crushing.

item.Name: Ruby
item.Effect: Deliver to Celio for use in the Network Machine.

item.Name: Sapphire
item.Effect: Deliver to Celio for use in the Network Machine.

item.Name: Magma Emblem
item.Effect: Provides access to the magma hideout in the jagged pass.

item.Name: Old Sea Map
item.Effect: Provides access to Faraway Island and mew.
